prompt: Design a 10-gallon shrimp-only, low-tech tank for a beginner.
overview: Beginner-friendly 10g Neocaridina setup focused on stability and humane care.
steps_week0_1: Rinse tank/gear; set up sponge filter and heater.
Fill with dechlorinated water; plant easy mosses.
Begin fishless cycle with bottled bacteria and light ammonia source.
Test daily; only add shrimp when ammonia/nitrite are 0 for 3 days.
maintenance: Weekly: 20–30% water change; gentle gravel vac.
Trim plants; clean prefilter sponge; top off evaporated water (dechlorinated).

citations.title: Neocaridina davidi — Species Profile
citations.evidence_quote: Tolerant of a range of water conditions when stable.

citations.title: Aquarium Cycling Guide
citations.evidence_quote: Ammonia and nitrite should read zero before adding livestock.

citations.title: Caring for fish
citations.evidence_quote: Provide stable, appropriate water quality and avoid sudden changes.
